scenario_name: TechNova AI Solutions – 2025 Global Product Innovation Annual Kickoff
company_context: TechNova AI Solutions is a mid‑size (≈850 employees) SaaS company specializing in AI‑driven workflow automation for enterprise customers. The Global Product Innovation (GPI) team consists of 120 members across three sub‑teams: Core Platform (45), Industry Solutions (50), and Customer Success Engineering (25). The GPI team reports to the VP of Product and collaborates closely with Engineering, Sales, Marketing, and Legal.
meeting_event_details:
June 10‑12, 2025 (3 days) – Aspen Mountain Resort, Snowmass, Colorado, USA. 
Day 1 (June 10) 08:30‑18:00 – Strategy & Vision. 
Day 2 (June 11) 09:00‑19:00 – Roadmap Workshops & Cross‑Team Hackathon. 
Day 3 (June 12) 09:00‑15:00 – OKR Alignment, Team‑Building Activities, Closing Ceremony. 
All sessions are in the Grand Ballroom (capacity 200) with breakout rooms on each floor. Evening networking receptions are held in the resort’s Alpine Lounge.
stakeholders: Maya Patel – Chief Executive Officer – Executive sponsor, final approval of budget and strategic direction
Carlos Ramirez – Chief Technology Officer – Keynote speaker on technology trends, oversees technical feasibility reviews
Leah Chen – Vice President, Product – Owner of the kickoff agenda, leads roadmap presentations
Rohan Singh – Director, Core Platform – Facilitates Core Platform breakout sessions
Aisha Al‑Mansour – Director, Industry Solutions – Leads industry‑specific workshops
Diego Torres – Director, Customer Success Engineering – Coordinates customer‑centric demos and success metrics
Natalie Brooks – Senior Program Manager, GPI – Responsible for logistics, vendor management, and on‑site execution
Jenna Lee – Head of People & Culture – Designs team‑building activities and ensures DEI considerations
Markus Vogel – AV & Production Lead (External Vendor) – Manages all audio‑visual and live‑streaming needs
Sofia Alvarez – Marketing Communications Manager – Produces event swag, branding, and post‑event communications
deliverables: Master Kickoff Deck (PDF) containing vision, market insights, and strategic priorities
2025 Product Roadmap (interactive PDF) approved by all sub‑team leads
GPI OKR Sheet (Google Sheet) with measurable objectives for Q1‑Q4 2025
Recorded video of all keynote and breakout sessions (uploaded to internal LMS)
Post‑event Survey Report (PDF) with Net Promoter Score and actionable feedback
Action‑Item Tracker (Jira) with owners, due dates, and status for each initiative identified during the hackathon
Swag Kit (branded notebook, reusable water bottle, RFID badge holder) delivered to each attendee
success_criteria: ≥ 95% of invited GPI team members attend in‑person (target 115/120)
Average session satisfaction rating ≥ 4.5/5 on post‑event survey
Product Roadmap receives formal sign‑off from all three sub‑team directors by June 15
At least 3 cross‑functional initiatives (e.g., joint feature pilots) are defined and entered into the Action‑Item Tracker
Event stays within the approved budget of $150,000 (±5%)
Net Promoter Score (NPS) for the kickoff ≥ 70
All recorded sessions uploaded and accessible within 48 hours after the event
constraints: Total budget capped at $150,000 (venue, travel, catering, AV, swag, and contingency)
Venue capacity limited to 200 attendees – must manage room assignments and social‑distancing signage
Travel restrictions for two international team members (require visa processing by May 15)
All deliverables must be finalized within a T‑60 planning horizon (i.e., 60 days before June 10)
AV setup must support simultaneous live‑stream to remote participants in three time zones (EST, PST, GMT)
Swag items must be sourced from sustainable vendors and comply with the company’s ESG policy
workback_prompt: Generate a detailed workback plan for the 'TechNova AI Solutions – 2025 Global Product Innovation Annual Kickoff' scenario. Include all major milestones, tasks, owners, dependencies, and dates starting from today (T‑60) through the event dates (June 10‑12, 2025) and post‑event deliverable deadlines. Highlight critical path items, risk mitigation steps, and required approvals. The plan should be formatted as a table or Gantt‑style list suitable for import into a project‑management tool.
